page.title: 10QUARNDON:ECOLOGY
page.content: THERE ARE MANY FOOTPATHS THROUGH THE WOODS AND FIELDS. PEOPLE USE THEM FREQUENTLY BUT TO ENSURE THEY ARE KEPT OPEN A FOOTPATH WALK IS HELD ANNUALLY. A LOCAL FARMER HAS ATTEMPTED TO CLOSE ONE. A SURVEY OF OAK TREES WAS UNDERTAKEN. THIS INCLUDED THE "JUBILEE OAK" PLANTED BY THE CHURCH HALL IN 1935 TO COMMEMORATE THE SILVER JUBILEE OF GEORGE V. 243 OAKS WERE COUNTED IN THE VILLAGE. THIS DOES NOT INCLUDE THE MANY OAK TREES IN THE WOODS. THE AGES AND SIZE VARY, BUT THE MAJORITY ARE ENGLISH OAKS, QUERCUS ROBUR. OF THE RECENTLY PLANTED OAKS 3 ON BUNKER'S HILL WERE PLANTED IN 1971. THESE WERE A GIFT TO THE VILLAGE. AN ELM TREE (IMMUNE TO DUTCH ELM DISEASE) WAS PLANTED IN THE SCHOOL GROUNDS IN 1982.
